title: School ‘knew bullied girl, 12, was going to kill herself but didn’t tell her parents’
text:
Madison Ocheltree killed herself in May, seven weeks after her school counselor and principal were told of her plans. They allegedly failed to inform Madison’s parents, who have now filed a lawsuit (Pictures: Chapel of the Twin Cities/Google Maps)

A school knew a bullied 12 year-old girl was planning to kill herself but didn’t tell the youngster’s parents, a lawsuit claims.

Madison Ocheltree texted a friend on April 5 this year saying she planned to take her own life the following month.,

The concerned friend showed a teacher, who told principal Clint Johnson at the Andros Karperos School in Yuba City, California, what Madison had written, it is claimed.

Madison was given one counseling session by school counselor Todd Tyler, but her parents were not told about what had happened.

And seven weeks later the star student hanged herself, with the youngster’s mother Morgan Ocheltree saying school could have helped prevent the tragedy.

Madison’s mother Morgan says she had no idea her daughter was ‘so alone’ before the bullied youngster hanged herself (Picture: Morgan Ocheltree/Facebook)

The Ocheltrees’ lawsuit claims: ‘No time prior to her death had [her parents] been notified of any problems of Madison’s intent to commit suicide and thus they were deprived of the opportunity to obtain counseling for Madison or otherwise address the problem.’

Their lawyer Steve Gurnee told the Sacramento Bee that Madison’s death was ‘very preventable.’

Football team blasted for axing little boys with disabilities

The sixth grader’s parents say they only found out about the worrying text after their daughter’s death, with Morgan saying she had no idea the youngster ‘felt so alone.’

Sharing a Facebook tribute to her daughter shortly after her death, Morgan wrote: ‘Please – talk to your kids, know their friends, be involved.

‘We did all that and still had no clue. We are beyond devastated.’

The Ocheltrees’ lawsuit, filed October 7 says the Yuba City Unified School District, Johnson and Tyler are all to blame for Madison’s death.

It alleges that they ‘demonstrated deliberate indifference’ by allegedly failing to tackle Madison’s bullies, and inform the girl’s parents of her suicide plan.

And the suit also cites a clause in the California Education Code which says a school is duty bound to inform parents or carers if they believe a student is a danger to themselves.

Yuba City Unified School District refused to comment on the suit, but paid tribute to Madison and called her death a ‘profound and heartbreaking loss.’

It is unclear whether School Counselor Tyler remains employed by the school.

For 24/7 confidential emotional support, contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 1-800-273-8255 in the US. For the UK contact Samaritans on 116123 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org for details.
description: Madison Ocheltree's school knew the bullied youngster was planning on taking her own life, but did not tell her parents, a lawsuit alleges
